parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: How much, how great, how many, as great as, as much. By reduplication from hos; as As.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
From a primary ergo; toil; by implication, an act.
From a primary nemo; law, genitive case, specially, (including the volume); also of the Gospel), or figuratively.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
A primary preposition; under, i.e. of place, or with verbs; of place (underneath) or where (below) or time (when).
Cursing; a curse; meton: a doomed one. From kata and ara; imprecation, execration.
For. A primary particle; properly, assigning a reason.

parse: Verb - Perfect Indicative Middle or Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: A primary verb; to 'grave', especially to write; figuratively, to describe.
From epi and a derivative of kataraomai; imprecated, i.e. Execrable.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.

parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: Who, which, what, that.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To remain (abide) in, abide by, maintain, persevere in. From en and meno; to stay in the same place, i.e. persevere.
(a) I make, manufacture, construct, (b) I do, act, cause. Apparently a prolonged form of an obsolete primary; to make or do.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.

parse: Verb - Perfect Participle Middle or Passive - Dative Neuter Plural
str2: A primary verb; to 'grave', especially to write; figuratively, to describe.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A papyrus roll. A diminutive of biblos; a roll.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From a primary nemo; law, genitive case, specially, (including the volume); also of the Gospel), or figuratively.
